documentation.text: @notice constructor takes in AAve lending pool address

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract"

arguments.value: This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract"

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address) view external returns (struct AaveLendingPool.ReserveData memory)

attributes.text: @notice constructor takes in AAve lending pool address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract"

attributes.type: literal_string "This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract"
attributes.value: This token is not compatable with AAVe. Please use a different payment contract

attributes.type: function (address) view external returns (struct AaveLendingPool.ReserveData memory)

params._amm: the ammount of interest to add
params._id: is the id of the loan

returns._0: true if added. Will not add interest if payment has been completed. his prevents lenders from refusing to end a loan when it is rightfully over by forever ncreasing the totalPaymentsValue through interest staking and never fully collecting payment. his also means that if lenders do not realize interest gains soon enough they may not be able to collect them before he borrower can complete the loan.

configureNew(address,address,uint256,uin.details: borrower is msg.sender for testing. In production might want to make this a param

params._accrualPeriod: What you put does not matter. It will be 1 second since it is 1 second for aave.
params._borrower: is the borrower loan is being configured for. Keep in mind. ONLY this borrower can mint bonds to start the loan
params._erc20: is the ERC20 contract address that will be used for payments
params._inverseInterestRate: What you put does not matter. Will always be based on aave.
params._minPayment: is the minimum payment that must be made before the payment period ends
params._paymentPeriod: payment must be made by this time or delinquent function will return true
params._principal: the origional loan value before interest

params._index: is the index in the borrowers loan array

returns._0: return if the contract is payed off or not as bool

params._id: is the hash id of the loan. Same as bond ERC1155 ID as well

returns._0: if delinquent or not. Meaning missed a payment
the loan principal (so bonds knows how many NFTs to mint)
returns._1: the borrowers address (so bonds can make sure borrower is calling this function)

params._erc20Ammount: is ammount in loan's ERC20 to pay

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

params._id: is the id of the bond to send in

addInterest(uint256,uint256).notice: Called each time new NFTs are minted by staking

configureNew(address,address,uint256,uin.notice: contract must be configured before bonds are issued. Pushes new loan to array for user

methods.constructor: constructor takes in AAve lending pool address

fulfill(bytes32,uint256).notice: Chainlink fulfill function. Called to set the merkle root for a request ID

getId(address,uint256).notice: Returns the ID for a loan given the borrower and index in the array

getInterest(uint256).notice: get the interest rate of a loan. Makes it easy for other contract since it doens't have to parse struct

getNumberOfLoans(address).notice: gets the number of loans a person has

isDelinquent(uint256).notice: This contract is not very forgiving. Miss one payment and you're marked as delinquent. Unless contract is complete

issueBonds(uint256).notice: called when bonds are issued so as to make sure lender can only mint bonds once.

payment(uint256,uint256).notice: function handles the payment of the loan. Does not have to be borrower s payment comes in. The contract holds it until collection by bond owners. MUST APPROVE FIRST in ERC20 contract first

withdrawl(uint256,uint256).notice: MUST approve this contract to spend your ERC1155s in bonds. Used to have this auto handled by the on received function. However that was not a good idea as a hacker could create fake bonds.

userdoc.notice: Is an example of a contract based on the ERC20 Payment Standard that matches AAve's borrow rate for the payment token anytime interest is collectedNOTE. The interest rate found in the loan struct is NOT accurate. The getInterest function must be used with this contract.
